bwwExcerpt: That fundamental drive — that feeling of questing clarity, of the necessity of returning to an old play to excavate its glowing, undiminished heart — is what Kenny Leon’s new Broadway production lacks. It’s not painful, but it’s far from revelatory. In certain ways it treads safely down the middle o...
showScoreExcerpt: ...with a play like Our Town — where its enduring miracle is both its granular mundanity and its immensity — the imagination is going to start firing.
